attributes.action: ban the speed camera when it is used not for safety but for entrapment
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is about time the government listened to the people of this country, after all we are the people you represent(suposedly).

It is morally and ethicaly wrong to put a speed camera on the side of a road purely for the entrapment of road vehicle users, and then you ask car registered owners to incriminate themselves or others, (what about your basic human rights) so local police authorities can reep in unethical funding, is this what the new labour have reduced themselves to?

How many decent hard working people have to be entrapped for this government to sit up and listen, if this government had not got this country into such and diabolical state then they would not have to exhort funds from the people of this country in such an unethical way.

The camera is a safety feature not a entrapment purpose for this government.

Why do you think there is now a general mood, called rip off Britain it speaks for itself doesn't it.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/speed-signs/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
